duties_responsibilities.duty: Work with various sized businesses in industries such as manufacturing, real estate, construction, financial institution, not-for-profit, healthcare, and private equity to provide hands-on client experience.
Assist in the design and optimization of controls for internal audit services, including business processes, accounting, and information technologies.
Identify internal control deficiencies, evaluate their risk implications, and advise clients on appropriate conclusions.
Engage with client leadership on strategies to anticipate emerging technology risks.
Assist in creating internal control documentation to support client engagements.
Perform Information Technology controls testing in support of financial statement audits.
Engage in technical IT controls review and internal audits over ERP systems, IT security, and other IT systems.
Participate in Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX)/regulatory and compliance engagements for application and IT controls and System and Controls (SOC) reporting.

education_certification.credential: Pursuing at least a B.A./B.S. degree or equivalent from an accredited university, with expected completion of the degree by December 2024 or June 2025.
Major in Accounting and/or related degrees OR Major in Information Systems and/or related degrees.
Certification or working towards certification as a CPA, CISA, or CIA preferred, not required.
